title: Hanging, "Syrian Olive Tree", ca. 1922
medium:
Medium: silk
Technique: wax resist dyed (batik) on warp-faced plain weave
markings: Bush-Brown's monogram w/ stylized beech tree. Monogram in lower right corner: LBB.
description: Vertical rectangular silk mural. Pastoral landscape with four goats before a large olive tree to the left of which stands a shepherd. Borders are a repeat of pointed arches. Violet, light grey and red on ivory fabric, lined with light rose cotton plain weave.

tombstone.epitaph:
Hanging, "Syrian Olive Tree", ca. 1922.
ca. 1922. Medium: silk
Technique: wax resist dyed (batik) on warp-faced plain weave. Gift of Lydia Bush-Brown. 1974-23-2.
